com.centurylink.mdw.soccom

Class SoccomClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.soccom.SoccomClient

  • public class SoccomClient
extends Object
    This class defines the method for soccom client. Sample usage: 
        try {
        SoccomClient client = new SoccomClient(host, port);
        client.putreq("test message");
        String resp = client.getresp();
        System.out.println("response: " + resp);
        client.close();
    } catch (SoccomException e) {
        System.out.println("Exception: " + e);
    }
    For large messages, if we'd like to get the messages line-by-line in order to display first part of messages before the entire message is received, instead of getresp(), we can use the following code: 
        String resp = client.getresp_first();
    System.out.println("response first: " + resp);
    while (client.getresp_hasmore()) {
        resp = client.getresp_next();
        System.out.println("response next: " + resp);
    }
    Similarly, we can also send message line-by-line, as shown in the following example: 
        String endmark = "////";
    putreq_vheader(endmark);
    for (int i=0; i<number_of_lines; i++) {
        putreq_vline(lines[i]);
    }
    putreq_vfooter(endmark);
    It is not necessary to open/close the connection for each request, although a server or a pool has a limited number of open connection allowed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoccomClient

        public SoccomClient(String host,
                    String port,
                    PrintStream log)
             throws SoccomException
        Basic constructor.
        Parameters:
        host - Either a domain name or an IP address.
        port - The port number.
        log - A PrintStream for printint log lines
        Throws:
        SoccomException - The exception is thrown possibly because of the following reasons:
        • Host name is unknown
        • Cannot connect to the service
        • Failed to create the socket

      • SoccomClient

        public SoccomClient(String host,
                    String port)
             throws SoccomException
        Alternative constructor. It has no parameter for log PrintStream and it logs all messages to the terminal screen.
        Parameters:
        host - Either a domain name or an IP address.
        port - The port number.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - The exception is thrown possibly because of the following reasons:
        • Host name is unknown
        • Cannot connect to the service
        • Failed to create the socket

    • Method Detail

      • putreq

        public void putreq(String msg)
            throws SoccomException
        Send a request message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be sent.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • putreq_vheader

        public void putreq_vheader(String endmark)
                    throws SoccomException
        Send the header part of a variable-size request message.
        Parameters:
        endmark - Must be a four character string that will not appear at the beginning of a line in message body.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • putreq_vline

        public void putreq_vline(String msg)
                  throws SoccomException
        Send a line as a part of a variable-size request message.
        Parameters:
        msg - A line of message. If it is not ended with a new line character, add it.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • putreq_vfooter

        public void putreq_vfooter(String endmark)
                    throws SoccomException
        Mark the end of a variable-size message.
        Parameters:
        endmark - This must be the same one as used in the putreq_vheader.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • getresp

        public String getresp(int timeout)
               throws SoccomException
        Get the response from the server, after sending a request.
        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout value in seconds
        Returns:
        The response message.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • getresp

        public String getresp()
               throws SoccomException
        This is the same as getresp(int timeout) except the timeout value is set to the default 120 seconds.
        Returns:
        The response message.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Thrown when an IOException is encountered.

      • getresp_first

        public String getresp_first(int maxbytes,
                            int timeout)
                     throws SoccomException
        The method receives the first part of response message from the server, up to maxbytes bytes. Use getresp_hasmore and getresp_next to get getresp_rest to get the remaining part of messages. When the server sends the message using ENDM, the string returned may be longer than maxbytes, but only till the first line after that. When maxbytes is 0, the procedure reads the first line.
        Parameters:
        maxbytes - The maximum number of bytes to be returned.
        timeout - timeout in seconds
        Returns:
        The string converted from the bytes read.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Any transmission error such as reading socket error.

      • getresp_first

        public String getresp_first(int maxbytes)
                     throws SoccomException
        same as getresp_first(int maxbytes, int timeout) except the timeout is default to 120 seconds
        Throws:
        SoccomException

      • getresp_first

        public String getresp_first()
                     throws SoccomException
        same as getresp_first(int maxbytes, int timeout) except the timeout is default to 120 seconds and maxbytes is 0
        Throws:
        SoccomException

      • getresp_hasmore

        public boolean getresp_hasmore()
        The method checks if the message is completed read.
        Returns:
        true if the message has not been completed read by getresp_first() or getresp_next().

      • getresp_next

        public String getresp_next(int maxbytes)
                    throws SoccomException
        The method receives the next part of response message from the server, up to maxbytes bytes. The method must only be called following a call to getresp_first or another getresp_next when getresp_hasmore is true. When the server sends the message using ENDM, the string returned may be longer than maxbytes, but only till the first line after that. The timeout value is inherited from getresp_first. When maxbytes is 0, read till the end of a line ('\n' is included)
        Parameters:
        maxbytes - The maximum number of bytes to be returned.
        Returns:
        The string converted from the bytes read.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - Any transmission error such as reading socket error.

      • getresp_next

        public String getresp_next()
                    throws SoccomException
        Same as getresp_next(0), i.e. read in the next line
        Throws:
        SoccomException

      • call

        public static String call(String serverspec,
                          String msg,
                          int timeout,
                          PrintStream log)
                   throws SoccomException
        This method is a simple wrapper for synchronous invocation of server's service. It is roughly implemented as: 
            SoccomClient soccom = new SoccomClient(host,port,log);
    putreq(msg);
    return getresp();
    soccom.close();
        Parameters:
        serverspec - In the form of host:port. If ':' is missing, assume port is 4001
        msg - The message to be sent.
        timeout - Time out in seconds
        log - For logging information
        Returns:
        The respose message.
        Throws:
        SoccomException - It passes up any exception encountered along the way.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the connection. This is automatically called at garbage collection but it is a good idea to voluntarily call it as soon as the connection is not needed any more.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        The method calls close() if the socket has not been closed yet.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object

      • main

        public static void main(String[] argv)
                 throws Exception
        This method allows to send a message from the command line. As an example: 
            java com.qwest.magic.soccom.SoccomClient magicdevl 4001 "test msg"
        Throws:
        Exception
